meanings.definition: One who incites or urges on; an instigator.
meanings.sent1: The inciter of the group always encouraged everyone to take risks.
meanings.sent2: The police identified the inciter of the riot and took appropriate action.
meanings.sent3: The inciter of fun and laughter at the party was the clown with the red nose.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as an inciter, sparking a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The inciter of change, she always pushed for new ideas and innovation.

meanings.definition: To stir, encourage, or urge on; stimulate or prompt to action.
meanings.sent1: The coach tried to inciter the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent2: His passionate speech incitered the crowd to join the protest.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies incitered him to enter the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery incitered her to start painting again.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring movie incitered her to pursue her dreams with determination.
